name: v0.2.0
body:
See [v0.2.0 milestone issues](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/7?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.9...v0.2.0).

New features:
- `stdout` can be written to once per barrier (#155).
- New `builtin` and `command` builtins that unambiguously invoke a Fildesh builtin or system command (#158).
- New `capture_string` builtin that echoes input lines containing a particular string.
- New `cmptxt` builtin that compares line-by-line, ignoring trivial differences in line endings.
- New `sxpb2yaml` builtin that converts Sxpb format to YAML.
- Sxpb supports multiline strings, bare strings, toplevel arrays, and many more improvements (#152).
  - See https://grencez.dev/2024/sxpb-string-grammar-20240717 for reference and examples.
  - Also see examples in [eg/ansible/motd.sxpb](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/blob/v0.2.0/eg/ansible/motd.sxpb) and [eg/sxpb_string/grammar.sxpb](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/blob/v0.2.0/eg/sxpb_string/grammar.sxpb).

Notable bugfixes:
- Comments were not ignored in some parts of a script (#148).
- Failing lines of a script did not always print line number and it wasn't always accurate (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/commit/f513d6e98cf117265c2cde76d720d4ca06e20775).

Breaking:
- The `Filename` type has been renamed as `Filepath` (#161).
- Public Bazel macros have been moved to their own files in `//tool/bazel/` (#146).
- Sxpb arrays now look like `(a (()) 1 2 3)` (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/commit/e9421ebbb546cf38bf2051d02fdc38dcf71f8216).

Removal:
- `sxproto2textproto` builtin (#142).
- `$(name)`, `$(HF name)`, and `$(H: name)` syntax in scripts (#98, #97, #94).
- Number-named positional argument variables (#99).

Deprecation:
- The `zec` builtin has been renamed as `splice`. Planned for removal in v0.3.0 (#159).

name: v0.1.9
body:
See [v0.1.9 milestone issues](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/10?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.8...v0.1.9).

New features:
* Sxproto data can be parsed with a specific schema in mind (#135).
* Cleaner sxproto syntax (#134).
  * Data files are referred to with `.sxpb` extension.
  * Quoted fields.
  * No more repeated fields.
  * Empty messages in an array are `()` rather than `(())`.
* New `sxpb2json` builtin (#128).
* CMake FetchContent support (#132, #129).
  * Example: https://github.com/rendezqueue/rendezllama/blob/trunk/dep/cmake_fetchcontent/fildesh.cmake

Notable bugfixes:
* Abnormal termination cleanup was doing a double-close (#124).

name: v0.1.8
body:
See [v0.1.8 milestone issues](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/9?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.7...v0.1.8).

New features:
* Script args after `--` are provided as NUL-delimited output of `stdargz` command (#110).
  * Use `xargz` to call another program with those args.
* New `stderr` command that can be called multiple times. Likewise in code, `/dev/stderr` is safe to open/close multiple times as a `FildeshOF` (#107).

Notable bugfixes:
* `fildesh_log_trace()` will now print something iff `FILDESH_LOG_TRACE_ON` is defined before `#include <fildesh/fildesh.h>` (#112).

Note: The released files are [1 testonly commit](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/commit/17af5a1ee367fd3129ba3bb9f0d6bccf26333613) after the v0.1.8 tag.

name: v0.1.7
body:
See [v0.1.7 milestone issues](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/8?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.6...v0.1.7).

New features:
* A `--version` flag (#103).
* C++ iostream-style headers (#106).
* Multi-line S-expressions (#101).

Notable bugfixes:
* Normal `Filename` variables are no longer deleted upon exit (#102).
* Double quotes in strings can be escaped (#104).
* Debian package is now built on an older system for glibc compatibility (#109).

name: v0.1.6
body:
See [v0.1.6 milestone issues](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/6?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.5...v0.1.6).

New features:
* Very basic Vim syntax (#82).
* Create filename variables like `(: my_filename Filename "my_filename.txt")` and access it like `$(XOF my_filename)` instead of as a string (#83).
* Create string variables from environment vars like `(: my_var Str (?? .self.env.THE_ENV_VAR "default value"))` (#84).
* Create string variables from options/flags like `(: my_var Str (?? .self.opt.the_flag_name "default value"))` (#84).

Notable bugfixes:
* Debian package now uses root owner instead of normal user (#93).

name: v0.1.5
body:
See [v0.1.5 milestone issues](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/5?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.4...v0.1.5).

New features:
* Temporary files can now be declared with `$(tmpfile my_var)` and referenced with `$(XOF my_var)` (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/68).
* Builtins can write to `/dev/null` without trying to actually access that file (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/80).
* Debian, Gentoo, and Docker packages.

Notable bugfixes:
* A script will exit early if it fails before a `$(barrier)` (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/72).
* Scripts can be read from stdin without errors (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/73).
* Bazel tests use the temporary directory provided by Bazel (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/81).

name: v0.1.4
body:
See [v0.1.4 milestone issues](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/4?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.3...v0.1.4).

Major language improvements!
* Strings that can be derived at parse time can be concatenated!
  * E.g., `$(> my_var) "hello ${world_var}"` creates `my_var` by concatenating "hello " with the value of `world_var` (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/66).
* Environment variables can be obtained as strings by calling `$(getenv MY_ENV_VAR)` (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/67).
  * Fildesh also gains a `-setenv "MY_ENV_VAR=some value"` flag to set environment variables.
* Scripts can be split into stages by placing `$(barrier)` between them (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/61).
  * It's somewhat restricted. Only string variables persist across barriers.
* Builtin commands can open a random data source as `/dev/urandom` (no file reading takes place! https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/60).

name: v0.1.3
body:
See [v0.1.3 milestone](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/3?closed=1) or the [full changelog](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/compare/v0.1.2...v0.1.3).

Minor language improvements:
* Variables defined with `$(> var)` or `$(H var)` can now be used directly as input files and streams like `$(XF var)` and `$(X var)` (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/51).
* New `replace_string` builtin. It automatically replaces `tr` for single-character replacements (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/56).

Library changes:
* Functions that introduce NUL bytes no longer work on `FildeshX` slices (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/57).
  * The new `while_chars_FildeshX()`, `until_chars_FildeshX()`, and `until_bytestring_FildeshX()` functions should be used for instead. The first 2 needed to leverage SIMD instructions (SSSE3-only for now) to perform as well as NUL-terminated versions.
  * The new `peek_bytestring_FildeshX()` and `skip_bytestring_FildeshX()` functions may be useful too, especially given a NULL bytestring to simply progress without a memcmp.

name: v0.1.2
body:
See [v0.1.2 milestone](https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/milestone/2?closed=1).

* Back to not using Bzlmod by default (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/43).
* `fildesh_test()` and `spawn_test()` Bazel macros have moved to `//:dev.bzl`.
* Spawn tool escapes Windows args now (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/48).
* New `expect_failure` builtin (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/46).
* New `fildespawn` tool to make simple commands easier (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/45).
* Named args can be passed to `fildesh` like `-a name=value` to populate `$(XA name)` variables (https://github.com/fildesh/fildesh/issues/41).

name: v0.1.0
body: First and last release on Bazel 4.
